Hello, coders!

Welcome to the SLU Computer Programming Club! This is a club where everything is about coding. We have weekly meetings at 4:00 PM on Mondays in the Linux Lab (Room 121L, Ritter Hall). Meetings consist of a 20-min talk and about 40 minutes of freeform collaboration and conversation. Talks are given by students, and focus on practical concepts and tools other students might find useful in their programming practice. Talks end with some interactive demonstrations to spark discussion for the remaining meeting time.

Upcoming talk:Genetic Algorithm by Dylan Lawrence

Get Involved

We use github for most of our activities. So please sign up for an account at Github first. Then make sure that your SLU email is shown somewhere in your profile.

There are several ways to get involved:

  • Apply to give a talk, See guide.
  • Use our github repos. Seeguide.
